item.source: Help me with this easy ::pure command

item.title: Help me with this easy ::pure command
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote="!Joshua, post:40, topic:310853"][quote author=Jordiescape link=topic=407312.msg3008340#msg3008340 date=1256581207]

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) {
    if (pure == 0) {
        for (int i = 0; i < 7; i++) {
            addSkillXP(15000000, i);
        }
        pure = 1;
    } else {
        sM("You already used pure.");
    }
}

He doesn’t want all combat leveling stats 99.

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) { if(pure == 0) { addSkillXP(105000, 0); addSkillXP(2000000, 2); addSkillXP(2000000, 3); addSkillXP(2000000, 4); addSkillXP(2000000, 6); sM("You're now a pure."); } else if(pure >= 1) { sM("You've already used this command."); } }
[/quote]
Then he can change the xp given, and skip the loop on the skill that he doesnt want. Simple.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 26, 2009, 12:24:47 pm[/size][hr] if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) { if (pure == 0) { addSkillXP(105000, 0); for (int i = 2; i < 7; i++) { addSkillXP(2000000, i); } pure = 1; } else { sM("You already used pure."); } } [/quote]
I updated my post with a better solution.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me with this easy ::pure command
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote="!Joshua, post:7, topic:310853"] if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) { if (pure == 0) { for (int i = 0; i < 7; i++) { addSkillXP(15000000, i); } pure = 1; } else { sM("You already used pure."); } } [/quote]
He doesn’t want all combat leveling stats 99.

int[] statIDs = { 0, 2, 3, 4, 6 }; if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) { if(pure == 0) { for(int i = 0; i <= statIDs.length; i++) { addSkillXP(200000000, i); } sM("You're now a pure."); pure = 1; } else if(pure >= 1) { sM("You've already used this command."); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Help me with this easy ::pure command
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

josh, tell me what is wrong with this command and why it wont work please.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure") && pure == 0) { pure = 1; addSkillXP(105000, 0); addSkillXP(0, 1); addSkillXP(2000000, 2); addSkillXP(2000000, 3); addSkillXP(2000000, 4); addSkillXP(0, 5); addSkillXP(2000000, 6); sM("Your Now A Pure Corruption pk Pker"); return; } else { pure = 1; sM("Now you know you already tried that..."); }

Read full topic

item.title: Help me with this easy ::pure command
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“EatU4Dinner, post:25, topic:310853”][quote author=xxlukexx link=topic=407312.msg3008302#msg3008302 date=1256580066]

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) { addSkillXP(105000, 0); addSkillXP(0, 1); addSkillXP(2000000, 2); addSkillXP(2000000, 3); addSkillXP(2000000, 4); addSkillXP(0, 5); addSkillXP(2000000, 6); sM("Your Now A Pure Corruption pk Pker"); }try it.

And all you did was take out my pure == 0 which puts it back to the same command i had befor, where people can type it more thne once.

i actually lol’d at your command, you dont need return; in a fucking command stupid.

just use mine or josh’s command, as we know they work.

as for “they can use it more than once”, why do you care? it gives the xp to the same skills, no others, so why u fucking crying?

@ josh, they both do same thing so dont say owt.
[/quote]

the command gives 50 attack and 80 everything else. if they keep typing it, they will eventually get 99 everything…which isnt what i want.[/quote]

why does it matter what you want? its what players want, they might not like the 50 att, 80 str etc, they may want 99 of everything, so stfu befor you talk since you dont know what they want. also, they dont need to do the command twice if they r happy with the stats.

item.title: Help me with this easy ::pure command
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“EatU4Dinner, post:1, topic:310853”]ok Heres what i got.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure") && pure == 0) { pure = 1; addSkillXP(105000, 0); addSkillXP(0, 1); addSkillXP(2000000, 2); addSkillXP(2000000, 3); addSkillXP(2000000, 4); addSkillXP(0, 5); addSkillXP(2000000, 6); sM("Your Now A Pure Corruption pk Pker"); return; } else { pure = 1; sM("Now you know you already tried that..."); }

Now my problem is that when u type ::pure once, it gives you the xp. when u try and type it again, it dosnt.
now thats all fine but theres a problem with the second sendmessage. it says that after every command. if i type ::yell, that sM comes up. how do i fix that?[/quote]

not the fact that, if pure = 1, then it does the command, but if its pure = 1 it will also send a message that you already tryed it.

simple fix, including the return; part which i think is rediculus.

Read full topic

And all you did was take out my pure == 0 which puts it back to the same command i had befor, where people can type it more thne once.
